meanings.definition: A person who abstracts information or data.
meanings.sent1: The abstractors at the library help organize books and documents.
meanings.sent2: The abstractors in the research team analyze data to find patterns.
meanings.sent3: The abstractors at the office party were the ones who summarized the meeting topics.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like abstractors, distilling complex ideas into simple concepts.
meanings.sent5: The abstractors in the workshop made the presentation easy to understand for everyone.

meanings.definition: A tool or software used for extracting or summarizing information.
meanings.sent1: The abstractors on the computer helped condense the lengthy report.
meanings.sent2: The new abstractors software made data analysis much faster.
meanings.sent3: The abstractors tool was so efficient that it finished the task in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The abstractors program worked like magic, simplifying the research process.
meanings.sent5: Using the abstractors app, she quickly summarized the key points of the article.

meanings.definition: The act of abstracting or summarizing information.
meanings.sent1: Her abstractors of the novel highlighted the main themes effectively.
meanings.sent2: The abstractors of the data made it easier to understand the trends.
meanings.sent3: The abstractors of the movie plot turned it into a hilarious comedy.
meanings.sent4: His speech was an abstractors of emotions, capturing the essence of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The abstractors of the presentation made it memorable and engaging for the audience.
